data.title: Lunch with college aged daughter
data.text: There were so many gluten free and vegetarian choices that I had a hard time deciding what to order--I will be going back. When it comes to eating out, cross contamination is an issue for people, like myself, with celiac and/or gluten allergies. French Meadow understands this and it's the first place that I've found that I can eat French fries without worrying about getting sick because  there's no cross contamination--they don't fry flour foods in the same oil as they French fries. I ordered the gluten free Rueben with fries and wasn't disappointed. My daughter and I had a pleasant lunch with excellent service.

data.title: New favorite restaurant at MSP
data.text:
We had a long layover and wanted a nice place to sit an eat. This place has been serving  dishes made from fresh, organic ingredients for decades. I had a cheeseburger with garlic aioli sauce (an odd but delicious combination), and my wife had curry. With that meal, this became our new favorite restaurant at the airport!

The bakery and cafe are two separate sides of the establishment. We ate in the cafe and grabbed some delicious dessert bars from the bakery to eat on our flight. Highly recommended if you have the time for a sit-down meal at MSP.

data.title: One of the better eats in airport but ok taste wise
data.text:
Their lemonade is pink in color! 
How does one make a pink lemonade? I dont know what they put inside the lemonade its freakishly pink. It doesnt taste of lemons..

Their green coconut curry is strange - its not french nor is it thai. They add tofu for $4! I felt its a rip-off for being vegetarian. But well its airport food. 

The service staff is efficient, they are not rude but not warm either. 

They have quite a big seating area so space wont be a problem but they are slow in recognizing that there is a line forming and they need to seat customers.

data.title: Quick breakfast
data.text: We had a little time to kill before our flight and stopped in for breakfast. We sat at the bar. Service was very slow, drinks were average but the good was good. It was worth stopping here rather than grabbing something quickly at the food court. You will pay the price though as this was a pricey breakfast.

data.title: Large tasty salads
data.text: This was the best food we've had at MSP.  The beet and pear salad was tasty and generous with fresh ingredients.  The service was quick although they didn't try to rush us off as we weren't in a hurry.

data.title: Take-out Awesome at MSP, Don't Dine In!
data.text:
I have been getting take out from here for 3 years.  The ready-made salads and sandwiches are always fresh and yummy.  The service is a bit abrupt but very fast and efficient.    They also have fresh fruit.

This time I decided to dine in... Bad decision!  The service was really slow; two people in a row sitting near me left after they waited for over 30 minutes for their order.  

Also, I arrived at 10:50am and, although I was given a menu with breakfast and lunch, I was told I couldn't order lunch until 11:00am.  However, when I tried to order pancakes from the breakfast menu, I was told that they didn't have any left.  Sooo, I waited until 11:00 and ordered a grilled chicken salad.  Ew... Wilted lettuce and rubbery chicken.

I can't really blame the waitstaff as they're not the ones making the rules.  Not sure if the issue is bad management or bad company policies but it wasn't a great experience.

My advice is to walk around the corner to their take-out instead or, if you want a sit-down meal go to Ike's which is right next door.

data.title: Skip the Food Court If You Have Time for Breakfast
data.text: Much better food here than the food court in the main terminal.  We had to wait for a table though for 10 minutes or so.  Beyond that, food was served pretty quickly and was much better quality than other fast food options.  Coffee was good, too - not the weak stuff you find everywhere else.

data.title: Light Healthy Food with a Limited but Nice Wine Selection
data.text: Not many choices in the Minneapolis Airport but this was the best option for a light healthy meal with wine. Our server was Great but had too many tables to pay attention to so service was less than great. But what do you expect for airport food? On our way out for an international flight just before the G concourse was a new sushi place we both wish we'd tried but oh well...next time!

data.title: Food ordering was chaotic and paying was worse, scone microwaved into a rubber tire
data.text:
I stopped here on a not-too-busy early Sunday morning for a quick bite.  I ordered a ginger scone and a cup of tea.  I was asked if a wanted it warmed a little.  "A LITTLE" I emphasized.  I also asked to leave more than an inch of space in my tea.

My scone was microwaved into the consistency of a Goodyear tire.  The tea was filled to the top, making it difficult to put in milk as I said I was going to.  

Making matters worse was some stupid woman standing at the end of the line for several other customers who then decided she had to pay and shoved in front of me.  How did she get out of the line without paying?  That's the restaurant's fault.

Poorly managed.  Like getting food in a battlefield.

data.title: Fantastic scones!
data.text: Always buy a scone and smoothie from this place for breakfast on the flight home, been doing this for years and have never been dissapointed

data.title: At 12:25 PM, the Muffins Should be Fresh
data.text: French Meadow Bakery has a great reputation in the Twin Cities. Although I've lived around here for 15 years, I've never visited one. After my flight landed, I was hungry, so I decided to grab something quick before heading to work. I spotted the French Meadow Bakery and decided I would grab a couple of muffins. I chose a chocolate chip muffin and a blueberry muffin and purchased them to eat in the car. When I got to my car, I opened the bag and pulled out the chocolate chip muffin. I couldn't believe that I had been sold what tasted like yesterday's muffin. I threw it back in the bag and grabbed the blueberry muffin. Again, I bit into a muffin that must have been from yesterday. I won't be going back.

data.title: 공항내 위치한 Bakery 식당
data.text:
미니애폴리스 세인트 폴 공항 1 터미널에 위치한 full service bakery 식당으로 food court 음식보다 선택의 종류가 다양하며, 샐러드 종류가 많고 가격도 상대적으로 저렴한 편임.
시간이 여유가 있는 경우 패스트 푸드나 푸드코트 음식보다 낳을 것 같음.
